programme.title: The Wager
programme.desc: Shawn Johnson & Andrew East“

programme.title: Legend FC #8
programme.desc: Legend Fighting Championship (Legend) was the Asia-Pacific championship of Mixed Martial Arts (MMA). Legend invited national champion MMA fighters from throughout the Asia-Pacific region to compete in a freestyle tournament using interdisciplinary martial arts skills in supervised matches under a strict set of rules designed to promote athlete safety and sportsmanship. Legend was committed to promoting the sport of MMA throughout the region, to supporting and cultivating its athletes, and to providing exceptional entertainment to a broad audience.

programme.title: M-1 Selection #2
programme.desc: The M-1 Selection is a MMA competition where the next generation of fighters are given the opportunity to showcase their skills on the world stage.

programme.title: Ismay Urged More Speed
programme.desc: How involved was Bruce Ismay with the operation of White Star ships at sea? Did he really urge Captain Smith to ignore ice warnings? Senan’s uncovered an account from the Oceanic that suggests Ismay overrode the command of at least one Captain in a...

programme.title: Remembering Ruth Becker Blanchard Part 1
programme.desc: In this episode, Ken Marschall gives us a compelling look back at Titanic’s last night through the eyes of survivor Ruth Becker Blanchard.

programme.title: Selling Second Class
programme.desc: Senan Molony gives us a rare look at a Titanic advertising brochure directed at second-class passengers. What White Star was selling in the cutthroat world of transatlantic competition back in 1912, might surprise you.

programme.title: Titanic's Pilot
programme.desc: We hear very little about the Pilots who navigated Titanic out of her harbors. Craig Sopin introduces us to David Smyth, who took Titanic out of Belfast Harbor.

programme.title: The Mirage Theory
programme.desc: Parks Stephenson gives us a clear and thorough explanation of the Mirage Theory. Does this theory really explain why Titanic hit the iceberg?

programme.title: Did the Lights Stay On?
programme.desc: Parks Stephenson introduces an eyewitness account who says that the lights stayed on in the aft part of Titanic after she broke! Parks also explains how this could have happened.

programme.title: How Did Titanic Sink?
programme.desc: He’s visited the wreck more than 30 times in the last 25 years. P.H. Nargeolet gives us his personal observations about the wreck and how Titanic might have gone down.

programme.title: Britannic Dive Part 2
programme.desc: For underwater explorers, the 400-foot dive to Britannic is at the apex of technical diving. Richie Kohler relates his harrowing life and death experience on Britannic in 2009.

programme.title: Titanic’s Pumps
programme.desc: Titanic’s engineers have always been an enduring story as they struggled with the pumps downstairs trying to keep them going to the very end. Was there ever any hope in their heroism?

programme.title: Five Scratches in the Hull
programme.desc: The prevailing theory has always been that Titanic sideswiped the iceberg creating a 300 ft gash along her side. Famed Titanic Explorer, P.H. Nargeolet, discovered five scratches down her side.

programme.title: Please No Smoking But If You Must
programme.desc: In 1912 people knew that smoking was bad for your health. Titanic had designated nonsmoking areas around the ship but if you needed to light-up, the smoking lounges were waiting. Bill Sauder tells us there was more than just smoking going on inside.

programme.title: Titanic's First-Class Lounge
programme.desc: What did you do in Titanic’s First Class Lounge? Well oddly enough you didn’t lounge, corsets and celluloid collars prevented that! Bill Sauder gives us a look at what went on inside Titanic’s magnificent lounge for the rich and famous.

programme.title: The Anchor Crane Mystery - Ken Marschall
programme.desc: When the first images of Titanic came back in 1985, everyone noticed how the bow anchor crane was turned to a very unusual position; even considering the crash into the ocean floor. Jim Cameron’s got one theory about what happened and Ken Marschall’s...

programme.title: The Big Four
programme.desc: Celtic, Cedric, Baltic, and Adriatic proceeded the design of Olympic, Titanic, and Britannic. Titanic Channel Host Mark Chirnside reveals why in many ways, they were perhaps the most successful quartet of ships ever built for North Atlantic service.

programme.title: Two Bath Tubs
programme.desc: There were only two bathtubs for all 709 Third Class passengers aboard Titanic. Sauder explains why probably no one in Third Class complained!

programme.title: Rescuing the Telegrams
programme.desc: Charles Haas shares the remarkable story of how priceless pieces of Titanic history were rescued before they were almost lost forever from a dumpster in New York City.

programme.title: The Untold Story of the Titanic Deck Chair
programme.desc: The Titanic story goes out in so many different directions and this is one of them! A Titanic deck chair, recovered by the Mackay-Bennett and later auctioned, provides us with a new Titanic Story that you might not have heard before from Craig Sopin!

programme.title: The Story Behind the New Titanic Photo
programme.desc: It’s been described as one of the most spectacular photographs of Titanic ever seen. Where did it come from? Andrew Aldridge will give us the backstory behind this remarkable photograph.

programme.title: Photographing Titanic
programme.desc: We have so few photographs of Titanic. Collector, Craig Sopin, believes there may be more out there, possibly even in the debris ﬁeld. In this episode, he gives us a rare glimpse of workers photographed on the grand staircase.

programme.title: The Lost Documents of Titanic: The Log Books
programme.desc: What could the log books from the Titanic and the Californian tell us today? Would they shed any light on the operations of either ship that night? In part one of this two-part series, Titanic Channel Host and author Charles Haas speculates what we might...

programme.title: The Last Remaining Lifeboat
programme.desc: John White, from White Star Memories, takes us through the preservation of Nomadic’s last lifeboat. From her discovery in France to her Belfast restoration, White Star’s last remaining lifeboat carries on the legacy.

programme.title: An Enduring Mystery
programme.desc: It’s the million-dollar question in maritime history! Who was this ship that sailed close to Titanic and could quite possibly have saved everyone on board? Very few Titanic scholars have looked into this more than Senan Molony. Here’s his take on...

programme.title: Road To One Water Race 2024 (Eng)
programme.desc: One Water Race is an endurance race based on Running, Swimming and Orienteering. 7 mixed teams of 4 athletes have to cross the Stockholm-Sweden archipelago from North to South in a non-stop 250 km race with 200 km of running and 50 km of swimming. They have to completely handle their navigation including in the darkness. Road to One Water Race helps us to discover the athletes and what is at stake in this crazy event.

programme.title: The First Second - Armel Le Cléac'h E
programme.desc: Armel Le Cléach creates his victories thanks to a strong relationship with the whole team of which he is the extension ... But for this navigator engaged in a daunting battle with the ocean on a giant 32-meter trimaran, each course towards a new start is a new battle with the unknown, with his own will and with his primary adversary: himself.

programme.title: Vendée Globe 2024 - Mag #13 (Eng)
programme.desc: A burst of arrival in Les Sables dOlonne commented by Michel Desjoyeaux, twice winner of the Vendée Globe. Jérémie Beyou (4th), Paul Meilhat (5th), Nicolas Lunven (6th) then the arrivals of Thomas Ruyant, Sam Goodchild and Justine Mettraux, 1st woman and who becomes the fastest woman around the world. We also see the teams from Sébastien Simons Imoca Groupe Dubreuil who are checking and repairing the boat.

programme.title: ÖTILLÖ, The Swimrun World Championship 2023
programme.desc: ÖTILLÖ, The Swimrun World Championship; 60 km trail running and 10 km open water swimming (in pairs) in the wild terrain of the Stockholm archipelago, is considered one of the toughest one-day races in the world.

programme.title: Kite Masters 2024 Episode 5
programme.desc: Following the event in Austria, the world’s top kiteboarding athletes eagerly anticipated returning to one of their favorite venues, Cagliari, for four days of intense competition at the KiteFoil World Series Sardinia to close out the season. Some of the biggest names in the kiteboarding world set the stage for thrilling action and we will watch how this played out in this episode. Next, the competition moves to China, where the scenic island of Daishan, located in the Yangtze River delta, would host the eagerly awaited Formula Kite and TwinTip Racing Asian Championship. The focus shifts to the WingFoil discipline. The WingFoil Racing World Cup season is underway, with Pingtan Island hosting the first-ever event in China.

programme.title: GKA Freestyle-Kite World Cup France 2024
programme.desc: Dunkerque, France, is a great location added to the GKA Kite World Tour in 2023. This spot is heralded as one of the best wave riding and flat water spots on the French coast. Therefore the GKA returns to this kitesurfing paradise in 2024 World Tour season! Here Freestyle and Big Air tricks make this the perfect destination for a spectacular freestyle event.

programme.title: The First Second - Samantha Davies
programme.desc: Samantha Davies sees the ocean as a pleasure, obvious. In symbiosis with her boat, she leads a violent struggle with the harsh conditions and "loves it" in an almost inexplicable way! She knows and enjoys her luck, which she shares with Initiatives Cœur. She also measures it to that of her grandfather, a war submariner…. At the start of a race like the Vendée Globe, it is an adventurer who sets off.

programme.title: Pierra Menta 2025 #3
programme.desc: Cette 3e et avant dernière étape servait de répétition du grand final de demain où, si la météo le permet, la course franchira le col de la Forclaz. Ce col situé au pied du Grand Mont est le théâtre d’une communion, sans égale depuis39 ans, entre les coureurs et les milliers de spectateurs massés à 2.374 m.

programme.title: Lekkarod 2025
programme.desc: Depuis 10 ans, la Lekkarod est une course majeure du mushing en Europe. Affiliée aux fédérations nationale FFST et internationale IFSS, elle est une étape de la Coupe du Monde. Chaque année, une centaine de mushers et leurs chiens prennent le départ des 9 étapes de la Lekkarod, ou de celles des Trophées !For the past 10 years, the Lekkarod has been a major mushing race in Europe. Affiliated with the national FFST and international IFSS federations, it is a stage of the World Cup. Each year, around a hundred mushers and their dogs take part in the 9 stages of the Lekkarod, or those of the Trophies!

programme.title: Julbo White Session Zermatt & Chamonix
programme.desc: The unique story of two skiing legends (Sam Anthamatten and Vivian Bruchez) who invite a passionate amateur, Philip Criveli, to climb and ride the north face of the Breithorn (in Zermatt) as well as the Passerelle and Aiguillettes couloirs (in Chamonix).

programme.title: Engadin Skimarathon 2025
programme.desc: The Engadin Skimarathon is the second largest cross-country skiing event in the world and the largest cross-country skiing event in Switzerland. Among the large crowd of participants are also world-class runners.

programme.title: Pierra Menta 2024 #1
programme.desc: La Pierra Menta est devenue au fil des 37 éditions, la compétition de ski-alpinisme de référence, un passage obligé pour l’élite de la discipline. Elle rassemble tous les ans plus de 200 cordées de 2 skieurs. Les français brillent lors de cette première étape de la Pierra Menta Axelle Gachet-Mollaret et Emily Harrop entête, William Bonmardion et Xavier Gachet à laffût. des résultats prometteurs pour la suite de la compétition

programme.title: Pierra Menta 2024 #3
programme.desc: La Pierra Menta est devenue au fil des 37 éditions, la compétition de ski-alpinisme de référence, un passage obligé pour l’élite de la discipline. Elle rassemble tous les ans plus de 200 cordées de 2 skieurs. Tour de force au sommet du grand mont! les équipes masculines et féminines françaises confortent leur première place au classement général de la Pierra Menta au cœur dune troisième étape clé pour la victoire finale

programme.title: World Rookie Freeski Finals 2023
programme.desc: The 2023 World Rookie Finals Freeski in Madonna di Campiglio, Italy, is where the world’s best young skiers are ready to compete in order to take the titles of World Rookie and Grom Freeski Champions.

programme.title: Highest Peak on Vancouver's North Shore - BRUNSWICK MOUNTAIN (Eng)
programme.desc: We summit Brunswick Mountain, the highest peak on Vancouvers North Shore, followed by Mt. Harvey right next to it. This video was filmed on the traditional, ancestral and unceded territory of the Coast Salish Peoples - Sḵwx̱wú7mesh (Squamish), Tsleil-Waututh & Musqueam First Nations.

programme.title: Summiting Mt Sneffels in Colorado (Eng)
programme.desc: Mount Sneffels is a prominent mountain near Ouray, Colorado in the United States which is over 14,000 feet high, more than 4,300 metres. Audree had never climbed a 14er, so we decided to try reach its summit while on a road trip through Colorado in late-July.

programme.title: World Rookie Freeski Finals 2025
programme.desc: The World Rookie Tour is excited that the Freeski Finals are held in the magnificent Ursus Snowpark at Madonna di Campiglio. This event shows the world’s most talented young freeski athletes as they compete in one of the most celebrated snowparks in Europe. This exclusive opportunity brings the excitement and competitive spirit of one of the most anticipated events in youth action sports directly to athletes, fans and viewers.

programme.title: Margalef - Climbing
programme.desc: Margalef is a little village next to the Monsant river, in Catalunya. The most amazing rocks in Europe and hundreds routes for climbing. Pure fun and climbing in this little entertaining film.

programme.title: 151 Miglia - Best of 2022 (Eng)
programme.desc: The Boat Show takes you to the best moments of the 13th edition of the 151 Miglia, Cetilar Trophy. With Bacci Del Buono aboard one of the largest and fastest boats, the Vismar 80.

programme.title: Swan One Design Worlds - 2021
programme.desc: Our Antonio Vettese welcomes you to Saint-Tropez for a special episode: Nautors Swan monotypes will compete in the Swan One Design Worlds. There is a very strong level of competitiveness, but there is always space for events on land, designed to aggregate and entertain owners.

programme.title: Miami Boat Show 2020 - Sailing boats
programme.desc: Do you want to cross the Atlantic or perhaps charter in the Caribbean? Whatever you are looking for, you will find it at the Miami Boat Show, where American market trends meet varied needs. This is the place to be.

programme.title: Sunbeam 32.1 - Boot 2023
programme.desc: Federico Maselli takes you aboard the Sunbeam 32.1, designed by the Jakopin studio and the designer Gerald Kiska, who made this boat revolutionary for the shipyards history.

programme.title: Sunreef ECO 80 - A sustainable catamaran
programme.desc: Hop on board the Sunreef ECO 80 and learn more about this incredible catamaran that aims for sustainability. How? Discover it with Antonio Vettese.

programme.title: Daysailers - Boot 2023
programme.desc: The Boat Show takes you on board the Daysailers of the moment, presented at the to the Boot in Düsseldorf. Find out these innovative boats with a Nordic soul.

programme.title: Miami International Boat Show 2024 - Accessories
programme.desc: Maria Elisa Altese takes you to discover the most innovative nautical accessories of the Miami International Boat Show 2024. The show is full of innovations and cutting-edge solutions proposed by companies from all over the world.

programme.title: It all begins with a dream
programme.desc: Selva Marine is an Italian company located in the middle of the Alps, in Valtellina.It all began when, one Sunday in the 1950s, the Selva family decided to go to Milan for the powerboat race. For Lorenzo Selva it was the beginning of a dream that he would soon turn into reality.

programme.title: Genova Boat Show 2022 - Inflatable boats
programme.desc: Bacci Del Buono is at the Genova Boat Show to present you some of the news inflatable boats at the event. Amongst them: Tecnorib P50, Ranieri International Cayman 45 Cruiser, Zar Formenti 95 Sport Luxury and Marco R26.

programme.title: Monaco Yacht Show - 2022
programme.desc: Welcome to Montecarlo for this new edition of the Monaco Yacht Show 2022. Let’s ear from some of the most important names in the nautical world.

programme.title: DC Boat Show 2024 - Highlights
programme.desc: This years DC Boat Show at National Harbor offers plenty of attractions for boating enthusiasts. There are a wide variety of boats, as well as interactive events and exhibitor booths for everyone to enjoy.

programme.title: How to - Anchor with Raymarine
programme.desc: Welcome to another appointment with "How to". In this episode Bacci Del Buono explains how to correctly set the alarm for anchoring.

programme.title: Venice Boat Show 2021 - part 2
programme.desc: Maria Elisa Altese and Federico Maselli take you to the Venice Boat Show. In this second part, they will show you the other protagonists of this years edition. Discover them with The Boat Show.

programme.title: Navico Axopar - Premiere in Palma De Mallorca
programme.desc: oin us as we explore the exciting collaboration between Axopar and Simrad. Discover how integrating Simrad’s cutting-edge navigation systems with Axopar’s innovative vessels enhances the experience on the water, making every journey faster, more enjoyable and, most importantly, safer.

programme.title: Hall of fame - Aldo Parisotto
programme.desc: Discover an exclusive interview with Aldo Parisotto, founder of architecture studio Parisotto and Formenton. Their research is oriented toward a range of different design themes, discover all about it.

programme.title: Halo 2000 – Halo 3000
programme.desc: The Boat Show is in Miami to discover the latest generation instrumentation by Simrad, the Halo 2000 and the 3000. These radars are easy to use and offer maximum safety.

programme.title: Bimax Alchimia 28 2023 - Ultimate efficiency
programme.desc: On-board testing on Bimax Alchimia 28 in hybrid propulsion with the maximum result of performance and energy efficiency.

programme.title: Venice Boat Show 2022 - Best of (Eng)
programme.desc: The Boat Show has selected the best moments of the Venice Boat Show. An edition to discover and enjoy.

programme.title: Monaco Energy Boat Challenge - 2023
programme.desc: Entering its tenth edition, the Monaco Energy Boat Challenge brings together the best green technologies for the nautical industry every year.

programme.title: Simrad - Glass Bridge systems
programme.desc: Hop on board the maxi rib Ranieri International Cayman 45.0 Cruiser and test the Glass Bridge systems by Simrad, with two monitors that display a lot of information.

programme.title: Greenovation
programme.desc: The Boat Show introduces you to an innovative patented technology that absorbs hydrocarbons and their derivatives dispersed in water. Its called FoamFlex200 and it was developed by the company Test1.

programme.title: Marina di Varazze – 2022 (Eng)
programme.desc: Join Bacci Del Buono as he takes you on a tour of Varazze to explore all the amenities and services of the marina.

programme.title: Swan 55 - Alegher (Eng)
programme.desc: Antonio Vettese is on board the Swan 55 Alegher and he is ready to interview Vanni Galgani, Head of product Marketing of Nautors Swan.

programme.title: Ultimate Lower Legs

programme.desc: Welcome to the Sportskool philosophy and how to achieve your fitness goals.

programme.title: Leverage - 16 Year Anniversary - The Nigerian Job (Pilot)
programme.desc: Nate Ford leads a team of expert thieves.

programme.title: The Lost World Remastered - Creatures of the Dark
programme.desc: The explorers have a run in with an underground civilization and an active volcano.

programme.title: The Lost World Remastered - Tribute
programme.desc: The explorers help the Tintas gain independence from the Hikari by teaching them how to fight back.

programme.title: The Librarians - And the Loom of Fate
programme.desc: Baird starts moving through alternate timelines that show the changing destinies of the Librarians

programme.title: The Librarians - And the Drowned Book
programme.desc: Jenkins discovers there's something wrong with the Library.

programme.title: Black November
programme.desc: Inspired by true events, an oil-rich Nigerian community wages war against an oil corporation to protect their land from being destroyed. Rebels kidnap an American oil executive and demand that his corporation end the destruction.

programme.title: King of Paper Chasin
programme.desc: In the city of 9 Million people everyone is engulfed in the everyday rat race chasing that almighty dollar. This movie tells the story of one of its own Carter Blanche. Carter has staked his claim to the American dream. But history teaches us that behind every wealthy empire is a major crime; and Carters rise to power is no exception. Trying to go legit, he is faced with deception, betrayal, and self serving agendas from those closest to him and must maneuver his way through all those who want to crumble what he has built. As he determines whos friend or foe. The decisions Carter makes can, and will cost lives.

programme.title: Graveyard Story
programme.desc: After a rich man discovers a grave of a little girl, some unknown force drives him to discover the circumstances of her death. He hires a private eye to do so, and discovers more than he ever imagined.

programme.title: Travel Girls Episode 10
programme.desc: This exciting reality series six girls have been chosen to compete for the chance to be a television star with their own travel show.

programme.title: The Blowouts
programme.desc: The travelers pass through Penas Blancas at the Costa Rican border. Their first stop is a visit with Janine, an environmentalist who shows the travellers how she has rehabilitate injured or abandoned wildlife. Shocked Neil explains to a bewildered team...

programme.title: Hey Fanoke
programme.desc: Anthony tries to reach Mark. Bobby returns with a fool proof plan. Nicky has his hands full with several meetings at the Bakery.

programme.title: Golf
programme.desc: Tobias is anxious and self administering acupuncture to remedy this. To add to his dilemmas, his friend, Lucy, wants him to be the father of her child. Tobias makes a quick getaway, opting for another date.

programme.title: Travel Girls Episode 4
programme.desc: This exciting reality series six girls have been chosen to compete for the chance to be a television star with their own travel show.

programme.title: Tahiti ? Wild Untamed Heart!
programme.desc: Join Ty as he leaves the confines of the Tahitian capital city of Papeete behind to discover the Tahitian jungle that enshrouds the primordial Pampenoo Valley. Then he is off diving in crystal blue waters for a photo shoot on a sunken PBY seaplane. Next...

programme.title: The Human Trace
programme.desc: Grisly murders have plagued the town of Solace. Local law enforcement is under suspicion and county detective Fishburn is sent, undercover, to find the killer. While staying at the hotel and getting friendly with local people, he quickly learns the towns

programme.title: Explorers
programme.desc: Gavin McClurg and Dave Turner take on the challenge of paragliding across 700km of the Alaska Range.

programme.title: Explorers
programme.desc: The story of an Inuit man who paddled 1,930km between Greenland and Scotland inspires young adventurers.

programme.title: Explorers

programme.title: 48 hours with Captain Durney
programme.desc: This is 48 Hours is with Capt. Oney Durney at Station 13. This firefigher has been with the department for so many years, they are not really sure as to how old he is. Hes nearing his retirement and trying to get as much time on the job that he loves so much before he has to retire. Take in mind, this guys is on both the USAR and Water Rescue team, we find him on Trucks and Engines, and hes still trys to be first-in. When you see him complete his Wildland Fire Training with his crew, its over 100 degrees, hes in his yellows, shovel or rake in hand, and he is out there heading up his crew. During the sit-down training sessions, hes gaining every bit of knowledge they are teaching today, to us, this guys a true Gladitor in the fire service.In this webisode, some of his brothers and sisters in the fire service give him a shout out.

programme.title: A Day Of Fire with Truck 4
programme.desc: 48 Hours with Truck 4s "C" Shift. They arrive on-scene to find a small trailer blazing and a possibly a dangerous situation with an LP gas tank near the trailer. The next day they are called in to a large apartment fire and our directed to perform one of the many things that the Fresno Fire Department does right, Salvage". They is where Firemen do their best to protect and preseve the belongs at the homes where there is a fire incident. Their respect for peoples homes and their personal property is something we have never seen with any other department. The truck crew starts salvage. In late afternoon, a call comes in as smoke showing from a building. The Truck Company arrives on scene of a Dollar Store and are directed to the rear. In the storage area, it is filled with smoke. The Crew bring out their thermal imagers and scan for hotspots.

programme.title: Matchbox Twenty - Live in London 2012
programme.desc: Filmed at Roundhouse, London, this concert film will give all fans a spectacular Live experience from start to finish. Matchbox Twenty performs their hits including "Bright Lights" , "Parade" , "You're So Real", and many more…

programme.title: Justin Bieber - Live at Madison Square Garden
programme.desc: The film follows the pop star Justin Bieber during 10 days counting down to his performance at Madison Square Garden. It also includes footage from his My World Tour, interviews with family and friends, a visit to his original hometown in Canada, and some of the story and videos of his childhood.

programme.title: George Michael - Rock Legends
programme.desc:
George Michael was born Georgios Kyriacos Panayiotou in 1960s London. His first solo album, “Faith”, had six top five singles that helped it dominate the charts worldwide. George had written and produced nearly every track. To date, it has sold over 25 million copies.
Featuring archive material, music videos “I Want Your Sex”, “Too Funky” and, exclusive insights from music critics and journalists Michael Bonner (Uncut Magazine), Hamish MacBain (Shortlist), John Aizlewood (Evening Standard)

programme.title: Best of Inspiring Forest Trail
programme.desc: A unique spot in the heart of the Laurentians: gaze over the peaceful lake as its smooth waves gently crawl to the shore.

programme.title: A Day in Paradise 3
programme.desc: A graciously flowing four hour long pure nature relaxation experience, "A Day In Paradise" immerses viewers in the sights and sounds of one of the world's most pure and picturesque tropical islands - for an entire day from sunrise, to sunset. Filmed in 2013 by David Huting, the tiny island is hidden off of the northeastern coast of the outer Fiji Islands (near Taveuni), and boasts a perfect white sandy beach, groves of palm trees, and a majestic lagoon that shelters the island from all sides. It has more turtle visitors than humans!

programme.title: Rainbow Reef Relaxation II 2
programme.desc: Immerse your senses on an unparalleled underwater journey to some of the world's most vibrant coral reefs and undersea paradises as seen in true 4K Ultra High Definition, paired to soothing new music by Relax Moods. Viewers will discover a plethora of stunning sea creatures, thanks to the incredible underwater cinematography by Peter Schneider filmed over the last several years.

programme.title: Pantai Ngopet: Indonesia
programme.desc: Discover the awe-inspiring waters of Indonesia with a tour of various vacation-worthy spots.

programme.title: Best of Inspiring Forest Trail
programme.desc: A unique spot in the heart of the Laurentians: gaze over the peaceful lake as its smooth waves gently crawl to the shore.

programme.title: amarcordplus & Sebastian Heindl - Baroque choral music by Bach, Schütz et al.
programme.desc: Five-strong vocal ensemble amarcord is joined by an extra alto and two soprano voices for this unusual concert at Leipzig’s St. Thomas Church. As amarcordplus, the ensemble presents a program focused on the city of Leipzig, which includes sacred madrigals by Johann Hermann Schein, motets from Heinrich Schütz’s collection Geistliche Chor-Music, as well as two motets by the most famous Thomaskantor: Johann Sebastian Bach. Moreover, various sacred works by lesser-known contemporaries Philipp Heinrich Erlebach and mononymous composer Liebhold are performed, in addition to compositions by other members of the Bach family, including Johann Michael Bach and Johann Christoph Bach. This performance was recorded on May 1, 2020.

programme.title: Les Dissonances - Classica Spotlight
programme.desc: Cinematic classical clips and energizing concert pieces featuring up-and-coming artists.

programme.title: Soloists of the Lucerne Festival Orchestra, Lucas Macías Navarro, Stefan Dohr & Jonathan Wegloop - Septets by Mozart and Beethoven
programme.desc: The soloists from the Lucerne Festival Orchestra present two septets in this engaging 2020 concert, recorded at Lucerne Culture and Congress Center (KKL), Switzerland. It opens with Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart’s Divertimento No. 11 in D major, K. 251, known as the ‘Nannerl-Septet’. Mozart composed it in 1776, probably on the occasion of his sister Maria Anna’s name day, whose nickname was ‘Nannerl’. The septet is scored for oboe, two horns, two violins, viola and double bass. The program continues with Ludwig van Beethoven’s Septet in E-flat major, Op. 20, which is scored for clarinet, horn, bassoon, violin, viola, cello and double bass. This 1799 piece achieved great popularity during Beethoven’s lifetime. It was arranged for many various instrumental ensembles, including versions for two guitars, and piano four-hands, but also a trio for clarinet (or violin), cello, and piano, arranged by Beethoven himself.

programme.title: Gewandhausorchester Leipzig - Classica Spotlight
programme.desc: Cinematic classical clips and energizing concert pieces featuring up-and-coming artists.

programme.title: Leonardo García Alarcón, Cappella Mediterranea & Mariana Flores - Vocal baroque works by Cavalli, Strozzi & Bembo
programme.desc: Argentinian conductor and harpsichordist Leonardo García Alarcón leads his ensemble Cappella Mediterranea in a program of Italian Baroque music. The ensemble performs some of the finest Baroque pieces composed by Francesco Cavalli, a prominent composer in 17th-century Venice, and two of his famous students, Barbara Strozzi and Antonia Bembo. Argentinian soprano Mariana Flores presents the vocal works. On the program are ‘Mira questi due lumi’ from Cavalli’s Le nozze di Teti e di Peleo, ‘Dimmi, Amor, che farò’ from L'Oristeo, ‘Sinfonia della notte’ from L’Egisto, and ‘E vuol dunque Ciprigna’ from Ercole Amante; ‘M’ingannasti in verità’ from Bembo’s Produzioni armoniche consacrate a Luigi XIV; Strozzi’s Sino alla morte, Che si può fare, Lagrime mie, L’amante segreto, and è Pazzo il moi core; Biagio Marini’s La Romanesca; Tarquinio Merula’s Aria Sopra La Cieccona; and Dario Castello’s Sonata Seconda. This performance was recorded at the magnificent Église Notre-Dame of Sablé-sur-Sarthe, France, on August 26, 2020.

programme.title: John Coltrane, McCoy Tyner, Elvin Jones & Jimmy Garrison - John Coltrane: Live in Comblain-la-Tour
programme.desc: The mere mention of the name John Coltrane evokes a deeply emotional, often spiritual response from even the most casual jazz fan. Dexter Gordon was a fantastic saxophonist. Miles Davis was a genius. Coltrane stood above - he was a visionary, a saint-like figure. By the standards of most jazz musicians, his life was uneventful. Sure, he had a heroin habit for a while, and Miles Davis punched him, but once he'd experienced the “spiritual awakening” described in the liner notes of his 1965 album A Love Supreme, he dedicated himself to his music with extreme single-mindedness. This broadcast of Coltrane's 1965 performance at the short-lived Belgian jazz festival in Comblain-la-Tour features Trane's classic quartet with Elvin Jones (drums), Jimmy Garrison (bass) and McCoy Tyner (piano).

programme.title: Errol Garner - Erroll Garner - Live in Singer Concertzaal, Laren
programme.desc: On June 18, 1962, American pianist and composer Erroll Garner performed at the Singer Concertzaal in Laren. The vibrant and joyous concert was played with drummer Kelly Martin and bassist Eddie Calhoun, each long-standing collaborators from Garner's trio. The Singer Concertzaal in Laren, the Netherlands is a concert hall and museum dedicated to the preservation of the art collection of American William Henry Singer. It features a variety of artists, both visual and aural.

programme.title: Christian McBride - Christian McBride - John Day
programme.desc: On July 20, 2018, double bassist Christian McBride presented his band ‘New Jawn’ at the Malta Jazz Festival. A five-time Grammy winner, McBride is one of the most requested, most recorded, and most respected figures in the music world today. Hailing from Philadelphia, this music luminary combines jazz, R&B, pop/rock, hip hop/neo-soul, and classical. Gracing the Malta Jazz stage with him are Nasheet Waits (drums), Marcus Strickland (tenor sax), and Josh Evans (trumpet).

programme.title: Coleman Hawkins - Coleman Hawkins live in Belgium, 1962
programme.desc: A jazz festival named after the inventor of the instrument most associated with the genre, Adolphe Sax, would be incomplete without the man who laid the groundwork for how the instrument is played today. This must have been the reasoning of the organizers of the Festival International de Jazz Adolphe Sax in Dinant, Belgium, when they invited tenor saxophone giant Coleman Hawkins to perform there in June 1962. Appearing with a group that includes the French pianist George Arvanitas, one-time Duke Ellington bassist Jimmy Woode, and expat drummer Kansas Fields, the musician also known as ‘Bean’ and ‘Hawk’ serves up an hour-long set of familiar standards bookended by Hank Jones’ “Chant” and J. J. Johnson’s “Wee Dot”.

programme.title: Cannonball Adderley - DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Wes Montgomery - Wes Montgomery - Nica's Dream
programme.desc: This selection of unforgettable performances by some of the most iconic and influential jazz guitarists in history showcases these legends’ unique essence. Revel in Wes Montgomery’s virtuosity as he performs the captivating “Nica's Dream” in Holland in 1965, and delight in the expressive beauty of his rendition of “Here's That Rainy Day”, recorded in London in that same year. Experience the timeless appeal of Joe Pass's “You Stepped Out of a Dream” and “You Turned The Tables on Me”, recorded live in Hanover in 1975. The interplay between Jim Hall and Atilla Zoller borders on the impossible as they perform “Extensions” in Hanover in 1973. Enjoy Jim Hall's lyrical solo performance of “I'm Getting Sentimental Over You” from 1964. Witness Sonny Sharrock’s avant-garde fusion of jazz and rock in an exhilarating performance of “Peanut", recorded live in France in 1970. Sharrock is joined by flutist Herbie Mann in a soulful performance of “Memphis Underground” from 1969. Immerse yourself in the magic of jazz guitar!

programme.title: Bobby McFerrin - Bobby McFerrin - Estival Jazz Lugano
programme.desc: Estival Jazz Lugano is an annual, open-air music festival that takes place over five days in the picturesque city of Lugano, Switzerland. Since 1979, this musical Mecca has been a must-attend event for all jazz and world music fans worldwide. In 1985, American vocal virtuoso Bobby McFerrin took the stage solo at Estival Jazz Lugano. The one-man musical force stunned the audience with his unique vocal percussion as he delved into the crowd for this quirky and charming act.

programme.title: Thelonious Monk - DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Kenny Barron - Kenny Barron, Song for Abdullah
programme.desc: Pianist Kenny Barron’s June 27, 2019 appearance at the Alfa Jazz Festival in Ukraine’s Lviv was a celebration of sublime jazz virtuosity. The revered elder statesmen of jazz piano brought his regular working trio of Kiyoshi Kitagawa (bass) and Jonathan Blake (drums), augmented by stellar jazzman Marcus Strickland (tenor saxophone) and young lion Riley Mulherkar (trumpet). Their seamless blend of classic bebop and modern explorations spoke of a deep, emotive connection to each note, captivating the Ukrainian audience with lyrical improvisations during this unforgettable concert.

programme.title: Michel Legrand - Michel Legrand Orchestra at Spa, 1982
programme.desc: Known outside jazz circles mainly for his film scores, French composer, arranger and pianist Michel Legrand has had a long and storied career in music. Interpreters of his compositions include jazz legends such as Sarah Vaughan, Stan Getz, and Bill Evans, as well as pop stars such as Barbra Streisand and Frank Sinatra. During this 1982 performance in the Belgian town of Spa, Legrand leads his orchestra through a number of original songs, including “The Summer Knows,” “What Are You Doing the Rest of Your Life?” and “Les Moulins de mon Cœur.” Singing either in English or French, Legrand delivers a spirited performance with plenty of romantic flair that is sure to capture your heart.

programme.title: The Wrap

programme.title: World Poker Tour
programme.desc: The World Poker Tour ignited the global poker boom with the creation of this unique television show based on a series of high-stakes tournaments, and has broadcast globally in over 150 countries and territories. Televised WPT events turned Gus Hansen into the Great Dane and Daniel Negreanu into Kid Poker, and created dozens of poker-made millionaires.

programme.title: BOX SEATS - The NBA Draft Review
Box Seats - Week 2 Of NFL In Review NBA Playoffs
Box Seats (Sports_Comedy Talk Show) Interview With NBA Vet Rod Strictland
Upper Peninsula Backcountry
programme.desc: At the end of the day, snowboarding is really about having a fun time with your friends. So whether these guys find a fun line to ride or not, they are having a good time in the search for the elusive Upper Peninsula Backcountry. Backcountry snowboarding is growing in popularity as people are getting tired of high prices and huge crowds at the ski resort. Snowboarders are also finding that the backcountry offers more of a connection to nature, which some find very appealing. “Backcountry” for the sake of this movie simply means anywhere in nature that is not within bounds of a ski resort.

programme.title: Ski Legends
programme.desc: Ski Legends follows three skiers in their 80s and 90s, celebrating their passion, skills, and philosophies on staying active. Award-winning, Whistler Film Festival 2019 selection.

programme.title: Line & Air
programme.desc: This Snowboard/Ski documentary of epic proportions follows 3 world class riders in their quest to shred a series of iconic mountains and lines in the Alps. Meet Geraldine Fasnacht: Basejumper, wingsuiter, glaciers pilot, and triple winner of the Verbier X-treme, the world's most extreme competition. Geraldine’s list of experiences embody the spirit of thrill seeking. And now she’s leading the charge to further push limits in the world of high alpine using a plane. She invites on board, Marion Hearty: Snowboarder driven by an endless quest for discovery, dominating the competitive freeride world, fuelling a desire to become a pilot herself. And Christina Lusti: Strongwilled Canadian charger with an appetite for huge and steep lines, she’s built a highly versatile persona for herself, linking all key mountain practices to access the inaccessible. Geraldine invited us aboard her ULM (ultralight plane) to share her philosophy and fly through incredible landscapes drawing lines with her snowboard in the film, Line&Air. It's a raw take on what it means to achieve goals in uncertain terrain and follows in the footsteps of past pioneers who only dreamt of touching down on such sensitive terrain. Official Selections 2022: Kendal Mountain Film Festival, iF3 Chamonix Festival.

programme.title: Blinded by the White
programme.desc: As Storm Show enters it’s 19th year of adrenalized Jackson Hole ski films, they’re bringing the World Premiere back to the original stomping grounds at the Snow King Hotel Ballroom. Featuring classic JH lines and digging ever deeper into the Teton Range and beyond, The original Storm Show crew is joined by some new blood for their 2019 release. With a custom soundtrack to match, producer Darrell Miller has cut a heavy hitting and realistic look at ski life in Jackson Hole. Crushing pow in the day and apres’ skiing all night, you’re gonna be Blinded By The White!

programme.title: Chaos Glacier Country
programme.desc: A team of weekend adventurers embarks on a daring mission to conquer British Columbia's Mt Waddington, facing a cascade of obstacles from the get-go. Hindered by bad weather and inaccessible routes, they're dropped at Scimitar Glacier, far from their intended base camp. Complicating matters, half the team opts for antique gear reminiscent of a historic expedition, only to find it woefully inadequate against nature's onslaught. Hindered by a novice filmmaker and thwarted by treacherous terrain, their attempts to reach Mt Waddington falter. Forced to adapt, they pivot to a lesser peak, Mt Munday, culminating their journey in a poignant tribute to past pioneers.

In the Welterweight division, Francisco Cordoba takes on fellow Belgian Bryan Sumbu, Abdelmalek Djebari of France faces Jose Batumeni of Belgium in a heavyweight battle, in a featherweight fight between two young debut fighters, Christevie Mukele faces Alexandre Sever and Edmond Gazarian from Armenia steps into the ring with Josue Ngandu from Belgium. United Fight Alliance presents King of Kings Bushido 84 from Belgium, Brussels part 2. In a heavyweight matchup Jurgen Dolch faces fellow Belgian Mohamed El, two undefeated fighters face off next as Shamil Irisbiev from Belgium takes on David Hawker representing Curaçao, French fighters Ibrahima Sene and Salim El face of next, then in a heavyweight bout, Stanislav Romanov from the Netherlands squares off against Arif Krasniqi from Albania.

programme.title: Flying on water - James O'Hagan tries out the latest addition to the surfing family
programme.desc: It looks like a surfboard, it moves like a surfboard, but its not a surfboard. Its an electric hydrofoil or E-foil. I visited Dubai Marine to have a go at E-foiling myself and find out what makes the activity so thrilling. The man putting me through my paces was Daniel van Dooren, the manager of Ibiza Foils and co-founder of Surf House Dubai . "The thing that makes it different is this hydrofoil wing on the bottom," explained Daniel. "Its got an aeroplane design, which basically lifts you out of the water and gives you that sensation like you’re flying." The E-foils are powered by an electric propeller and controlled remotely via Bluetooth. They can reach speeds of up to 45km an hour. Find out how I got on with my first experience on an E-foil by watching the video above this article. Heres a clue: I wont be giving up my day job anytime soon.

programme.title: Relaxing on the Ventura County Coast
programme.desc: With botanical gardens, parks, beaches, harbors and a vibrant downtown, Ventura County gives you endless ways to relax. See our spots here!

programme.title: La Mer, Dubai’s newest beachfront neighbourhood, offers hip restaurants, water sports and fun parks
programme.desc: With the construction of Dubai’s latest luxury residential development, Port de La Mer by Meraas , and new hotel, Rove La Mer , La Mer is a of rising interest in today’s property market. La Mer, open since 2017, is one of Dubai’s most colourful seaside neighbourhoods, nestled on the northern shoreline. Divided into two areas, La Mer South and La Mer North, it’s defined by its retro Californian style. The Instagram-friendly destination offers a heady mix of water sports, fun parks, fashionable restaurants, street art and seasonal parties after dark. By day, visitors can hire sunbeds or rent wooden day rooms on La Mer Beach. The multi-coloured beach huts house showers. La Mer beach club, Train , is fully licensed with a shisha area, but its name is derived from its fitness facilities – it has a gym and a boxing and yoga studio – and its Origin 33 restaurant and lounge also serves healthy meals and a menu of fresh juices and smoothies. The best restaurants in La Mer, according to local award-givers, include Masti , a beachfront eatery applauded for its modern Indian cuisine, innovative mixology and eclectic interior design by Studio Lotus. The name Masti is derived from the Hindi word for fun and mischief and the décor and dishes live up to the name, with cheeky monkey artwork and playful fusions for the palate such as the tandoori chicken bao. Another creative culinary outlet is iScream . Managing Partner Rami Halawi came up with the concept for iScream with his family. Offering a wide selection of unusual flavours is the brand’s unique selling point. “Here at iScream, we’re very crazy; thats why we have crazy flavours like curry, kulfi, tabbouleh, ketchup and Mexican chilli-chocolate,” says Rami. On certain days, customers are invited to scream into a sound monitor for their ice cream – if they beat the highest recording in decibels, they win their ice cream for free. La Mer’s shops focus on beach pursuits and accessories, making it a good place to shop for swimwear, sunglasses, suntan lotion

programme.title: Judy Joo's Ethnic Bites in London
programme.desc: Iron Chef Judy Joo shares her cant-miss list of ethnic dining in London. From dim sum in Soho to sushi in Marylebone, find the best here.

programme.title: Karaiya Spice House
programme.desc: For those that like to feel the burn, make a trip to Karaiya Spice House for some Hunan-style heat. Authentic Hunan dishes are beautifully presented at this award winning, lair of spice. A bouquet of Hunan chilis accompanies many of Karaiya’s menu items, but the restaurant does offer milder fare to tame the flames. Signature items include smoked ribs, steamed fish with chilis and flame-baked prawns wrapped in foil. Located on the 3rd floor of Sanlitun Village, Karaiya will also win you over with its elegant and understated design. Just remember that “normal” here is still very spicy.

programme.title: A Real Housewife's Guide to Family Fun
programme.desc: Model, mommy, Housewife & entrepreneur Kristen Taekman talks about some of her favorite family-friendly activities in New York City. See her list here!

programme.title: Redbird
programme.desc: If youve ever wanted to eat a standout meal from a veteran chef on the grounds of an old Baroque-style cathedral—and who hasnt?—Redbird can offer you that unique experience. The acclaimed restaurant is attached to the historic St. Vibiana cathedral downtown. Youve probably seen chef Neal Fraser on TV, whether it was cooking on Top Chef Masters or beating Bobby Flay in a fried chicken sandwich Throwdown, but hes also been one of LAs more influential chefs over his tenured career. Brunching in the spectacular glass-enclosed atrium courtyard is always a great idea, where you can munch on BLUEBERRY RICOTTA PANCAKES or more refined dishes like a FOIE GRAS TORCHON with strawberry and pink peppercorn. Dont miss happy hour either. CHICKEN-FRIED SWEETBREADS paired with a $7 gin cocktail is a hard offer to pass up.

programme.title: Li Qun Duck
programme.desc: Zhang Li Qun welcomes you to his home to experience this classic delicacy. And when we say classic, we mean the ultimate classic. Throughout the years, there have been many spins on Peking Duck, even in Beijing. However, Li Qun Duck roasts their duck in accordance with the Qing Imperial Kitchen and their production methods, including the traditional hanging furnace technique. In a very proud city rich with historical heritage, this is about as local as it gets. Tucked away in the winding hutongs of the Qianmen area, do not miss this hidden gem….you will savor this taste of old Beijing for eternity.

programme.title: Broken Spanish
programme.desc: Theres a distinct image that might pop up in your head when you think of Mexican food. It may involve a puddle of beans next to over-sauced enchiladas. It may involve yellow cheese and crunchy shells. It may involve trucks and outdoor salsa bars. It most likely does not involve crispy skinned pork belly studded with pungent elephant garlic and elegantly strewn with radish sprouts and micro herbs. But maybe it should.Chef Ray Garcia—a born-and-bred Angeleno—is on the forefront of the modern Mexican food movement thats taking over the city, and Broken Spanish is his swanky flagship. The aforementioned CHICHARRON is one of the best large-format meat dishes in a 50-mile radius, while the LAMB NECK TAMAL is all gamey funk and pillowy tender masa. For dessert, the CAFE DE OLLA is a Mexican firing squad of chocolate, beer, and coffee to the face. The hyper-modern space—a mix of retro concrete breezeblocks, macrame, and greenery—is the perfect spot for that mezcal nightcap.

programme.title: Durban City Rejuvenation
programme.desc: Durbans architecture has many influences and its buildings are being given a new lease on life as developers see their potential

programme.title: Mrs. Pound
programme.desc: Dont judge a book by its cover, this is not your average stamp shop. Inspired by a fictional story of secret lovers, Mrs. Pound brings to life the story of a former 1950s Shanghai burlesque dancer, her married lover (Mr. Ming) and their elaborate clandestine rendezvous space. Offering a new twist on asian fusion cuisine, the 45 seat venue features a lower dining room (Mrs. Pound), an upper dining room (Mr . Ming), and a bar area at which these two spaces merge. Mixed with plush velvet banquettes, vintage tiles, neon artwork, suspended mirrored marquee lights with lipstick messages, and a 1960s style showgirl glamour, Mrs. Pounds creative interior sets the tone for a unique and entertaining culinary (and drinking) experience. We like the Hainanese Chicken Rice, Thai Milk Tea Cake, Sriracha Street Corn, and Lemongrass Pork Chop. Although it will be a longer wait, do yourself a favor and go for dinner for the best experience.

programme.title: Animal conservation "a government priority" says United Arab Emirates
programme.desc: Dubai and the United Arab Emirates are making animal conservation a government priority at a time when biodiversity is under threat and more animals face extinction globally. A report by the United Nations earlier this year claimed animal extinctions are at an unprecedented high. According to the organisation, as many as one million species are under threat. On a visit to the desert, you might expect to find camels or antelope, maybe some hawks. But Dubai’s Al Marmoom animal sanctuary is teeming with biodiversity with hundreds of different species of birds, mammals, and reptiles. The sanctuary covers 20 percent of the whole area of Dubai. In the beginning, it was a desert populated by native animals, but as the sanctuary expanded to more than 50 oases, it was discovered these water bodies could control the environmental balance. The sanctuary has even managed to attract the Arabian Oryx. This animal was declared extinct in the wild in 1972, but has now been brought back from the brink by the reserve. Saoud Faisal is a wildlife officer at the Al Marmoom sanctuary. He says in the 80s and 90s the Oryx were overhunted for food. Now the animal is considered part of the regions wildlife. “They are totally protected now and also they are healthy,” he explains. “We have them in large numbers which last year reached more than 500." From desert oases to indoor tropical environments, recent laws in Dubai mean greater governmental support for animal sanctuaries. Laws were introduced in 2007 to cover animal welfare, but awareness really started to build in 2016. The laws also apply to rare and exotic animals. Some are looked after in animal sanctuaries like Green Planet. Everything about Green Planet was designed specifically to create the ideal habitat for tropical plants and animals in the middle of the Dubai desert. The sanctuary houses a wide range of species including many different birds, and mammals such as two-toed sloths. And lizards like green iguanas or basilisks. The latest addition t

programme.title: Taste Dubai: An Emirati Iftar
programme.desc: During Ramadan, practising Muslims abstain from eating and drinking during daylight hours. The meal that follows is known as Iftar, and you do not have to be Muslim to partake in one. In this edition of Taste, Euronews visited the Jumeirah Zabeel Saray Hotel in Dubai, to sample the special Iftar menu produced by the worlds first Emirati chef. After Athan, the call for evening prayer, Muslims who have been fasting all day can finally eat and drink. The fast is broken by first eating dates. This is of great religious significance, chef Musabbeh Al Kaabi explained. "Prophet Mohammed used to do this when he was breaking his fast, so we always break it with the dates then laban (a fermented milk drink) or water," he said. Chef Musabbeh first served up a traditional dish - king rice. Its name comes from its historically prestigious status as an expensive dish only eaten by royalty or the rich. "Liver is there, beef is there, saffron rice is there. So it’s all luxury things. I have cooked saffron rice, I have fried cauliflower, boiled chickpeas. Now I need to take the flavour of the onions with all these things," Chef Musabbeh said as he prepared the dish. "I will put the rice in now. I’ll put some spices in as well. So now, I’m going to put it on a plate, and I’m going to garnish it" But, before eating, everyone said Bismillā, which means in the name of Allah. Chef Musabbeh then prepared his second dish the famous Emirati ouzi with oriental rice, a lamb dish with cinnamon and cardamom. You can make the dish yourself by following the recipe below: Chef Musabbehs Ouzi and Oriental Rice Recipe Ingredients: 1100g lamb shank 500g of basmati rice 100g of minced lamb 2 bay leaves 3 cinnamon sticks 10g of garlic - freshly chopped 120g of onion - freshly chopped 100g of tomato - freshly chopped 20g of ghee butter Salt and pepper 6.5ml of water 10g of tamarind powder 40g of Emirati spices 30g of tomato paste 40g of coriander - freshly chopped Instructions: 1. Chop the onions, garli

programme.desc: Jewelry Designer Mira Ovaskainen tells us where to go and things to do in East London.

programme.title: Tokyo via New York City
programme.desc: Recipe tester Rachel Soszynski knows her Japanese cuisine. In this video, she shares her favorite places in NYC to experience ramen, izakaya and yakiniku.

programme.title: Tulum
programme.desc: At its core Tulum is a vibrant mix of extremely old and extremely new. Prehistoric natural wonders and ancient Mayan ruins are scattered among world-class resorts slinging more fresh lobster and mezcal than the human body is probably meant to consume. Long known for its yoga retreats and rustic eco-hotels, the off-the-grid Tulum of 15 years ago is still there, but it now exists alongside thrumming nightlife and unparalleled culinary adventures. Chefs and mixologists from around the globe have been lured to Tulum by its beachside DGAF vibe and a willingness to rewrite the rules. There are plenty of destination-worthy bars and clubs near the city’s central Hotel Zone, but if you want to escape the glitz—or maybe civilization itself—plunge into one of the region’s underground swimming caves formed millions of years ago, believed by Mayans to be a passage to another dimension. With breathtaking beaches, history you can touch, and a unique kind of artistic-inspired luxury, Tulum is whatever you want it to be. Oh, and there are lots of tequila and tacos, too. Do take advantage of that.

programme.title: Issaya
programme.desc: The dining room is a daring mix of classic and modern furniture on terracotta tile floors with unusually colourful wallpapers. The whole room basks in a very soft light and the result works surprising well. The menu, both in Thai and English, is not illustrated but cleverly written, keeping the phonetic dish names instead of an elaborated but hard to visualize description. The wine list is substantial and several excellent wines are available by the glass.

programme.title: Dubai acts to stem the tide of single use plastic
programme.desc: Dubai’s airports have banned all single use plastics as the city works towards a plastic-free future. It comes as the attitude towards single use plastics is changing. In Dubai, 90 per cent of people say they are making a conscious effort to reduce their own plastic waste consumption. Nearly four in five say they recycle more now than they did five years ago. And one in four people say theyre encouraged to recycle more by corporations championing plastic-free initiatives. Dubai International Airport along with Dubai World Central welcome almost 90 million passengers each year. But with those passengers comes 5,500 tonnes of plastic. The airports’ operator, Dubai Airports, banned all single use plastics from inside the terminal at the beginning of this year. That means that plastic cutlery, water bottles, drinking straws, packaging and polythene bags are all banned from cafes and restaurants. Eugene Barry, Dubai Airports’ executive vice president (commercial), told Focus: “Ninety five per cent of our partners have actually made the pledge to switch from plastic to appropriate and relevant substitutes for some of the products that are used in catering and retail across the airport.” The operator hopes its a strategy that might become a template for other major transportation hubs and businesses. “This is very much the early stages of a long journey, I believe, to have a more environmentally friendly approach to managing businesses,” Barry said. Dubai’s 700 hotels are already looking at alternatives, such as switching water bottles from plastic to glass. Plastic key cards could also be a thing of the past, as developers look into switching them to wood-based materials. The eco packaging company Avani is one firm offering plastic-free alternatives, including a bag made from cassava, a cheap and common root vegetable. The material is biodegradable and compostable, breaking down over a period of months on land or at sea. Peter Avram, managing director of Avani Middle East, said: “Until a c

programme.title: Best Pizza in NYC
programme.desc: Vivek George, founder of “Salt,” a smartphone application that helps you choose places to eat and drink, gives his list for the best pizza in NYC.

programme.title: Adult Camps - Not Just for Kids, Not Just for Summer

programme.title: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Theres the LA you see in the movies, and then theres the real LA—a gritty, fantastically diverse collection of neighborhoods sprawled between ocean and mountains, each with its own distinct mood. Los Angeles spent years striving to emulate towns like New York or San Francisco, but over the last decade the city took a long hard look in the mirror, dug what it saw, and started focusing on what it does best: casual, multicultural, and effortlessly cool.The new LA is the place everyone suddenly wants to be, where high and low converge on palm-lined sidewalks. The countrys most thriving food scene is here, run by a guerilla band of ethnically diverse chefs cooking up whatever they want, wherever they want, with the best produce in the world. From the industrial warehouses east of downtown to the beachside shopping meccas of Venice, LAs cutting edge street style, art scene, and culinary chops cant be contained—the creative energy pops through the concrete like ficus roots. And just to sweeten the deal, 280-plus days of breezy sunshine form the backdrop of it all. Just dont forget your shades.

programme.title: Ventura County Coast's Great Outdoors
programme.desc: Outdoor enthusiasts will find everything from mountains to islands in Ventura County. Our local experts tell us where to hike, bike, run, golf and swim.

programme.title: Cereal Killer Cafe's Guide to Fun London Eats
programme.desc: Cereal Killer Cafes Alan Keery recommends fun & quirky places to eat in London. Check out the video for some exciting & unique restaurant options!

programme.title: Keeping tradition alive in Dubai
programme.desc: Tradition isnt exactly what first comes to mind when one thinks of Dubai, a city that quite literally grew out of the desert, but tourists are flocking to the Middle Eastern oasis for a taste of its Bedouin past. Camel races Old meets new can be seen at Dubais Camel Racing Club where these ships of the desert sprint across the perimeter of the famed Al Mamoom racetrack. Attracting both camel owners and punters alike, spectators can sit in their cars and drive alongside the camels as they hurtle towards the finish line, guided by a remote control jockey. Organisers say the event is a draw for tourists for a number of reasons. “When tourists come to the camel racing venues, they see something new. They see how people treat the camels and how the camels compete with each other. They also see how Emirati society promotes camels, says the clubs CEO and General Amanager Ali Saeed Bin Saroud. Camel racing was promoted by the former UAE president, Sheikh Zayed bin Sultan Al Nahyan as a way of bringing camels and back into mainstream Dubai culture. The Dubai Royal Family also actively support camel racing as a way of preserving the traditional Bedouin culture. Desert culture The Al Marmoom Heritage Festival is Dubai’s annual celebration of the traditional Arabian desert culture and vital role which it plays in the cultural identity of its people. Traditional markets, music and dancing are another way in which the Bedouin culture is kept alive and enjoyed by Dubai locals and tourists alike. Arabic hospitality German expat Ursula Musch moved to Dubai around 20 years ago after first visiting in 1993. She now breeds camels and encourages tourists to experience the Bedouin customs for themselves, as they, like her, may just find their passion in life. My passion or my message is I want to give foreigners, other people the chance to know something from the Arabic hospitality, from their tradition, from their culture, to show it to give it to other people who don’t

programme.title: St. Croix Food and Wine Experience
programme.desc: Andrea and Teri enjoy the Taste of St. Croix as they sample the best in Caribbean cuisine, rum and wine from around the world. The next day, Andrea heads to the Sunset Barbeque where she talks to Chef Theo Gumbs and Evelyn Paul about their preparations and passion for cooking. The episode ends with Teri dining at Beachside Café where she tastes the culinary treats designed by Chef Chad Ford and get a delightful, melodic finish to her dining experience.

programme.title: Visiting Dubai's many museums
programme.desc: Dubai is home to a multitude of museums, from world-firsts to hidden gems. Quranic Park is one of the citys brand new attractions. About the size of 60 rugby fields, it has been created to give visitors some green space and a better understanding of Islamic beliefs. Inside the park’s orchards and Glass House, visitors can discover a variety of healthy and medicinal flora featured in the Holy Quran, from pomegranates and olives, to figs and garlic. Another attraction at Quranic Park is the Cave of Miracles, where seven miracles recounted in the Holy Quran play out on the walls. "The cave was amazing," says Usman, who is visiting from the UK. "We learnt a lot about the miracles growing up, it just gave another understanding to it. And it was great to visualise it, not just hear about it." "This is an open example that the Quran is not just to read in order to get reward but it is something that can be in practical life," says Anwar, a visitor from the US. "This place is beautiful and a very interesting experience for children. Here, they can actually experience things from the Quran," says Miteab, who lives in Saudi Arabia. Al Shindagha Perfume House From aromatic flora to the UAE’s first museum dedicated to fragrance. The Al Shindagha museum is home to the Perfume House . Part of a complex created to gather, preserve and share Emirati heritage, Perfume House charts the history and role of fragrance in the region. Rashed Almuhairi is Perfume House’s Chief Cultural Guide. “It’s special and important not only for the guests who are coming, he tells Euronews. "It’s for our own generations also. A lot of our youth, they didn’t live in many things like perfuming or pearl diving, so it’s important that they know about our past life. Dubai has a very rich history which needs to be told.” One of the more unusual exhibits on display is a 28 kilogramme piece of oud. Oud is formed in aquilaria trees when they are infected with a particular type of mould. This resinous heartwood is the key ingr

programme.title: The Palm Jumeirah: Dubai's symbol of creativity and ambition
programme.desc: Palm Jumeirah is often proclaimed the eighth wonder of the world, a symbol of creativity and ambition. This huge tree-shaped island was built from sand, rock and sheer determination. What keeps it all in place is this 11-kilometer breakwater crescent, lined with five-star hotels, this protective halo has two openings side that allows the famously clear blue waters to flow with the tide. Seventy-eight thousand residents call Palm Jumeirah home, living in luxury apartment blocks on the trunk and private gated estates on the fronds. Its also the address of some of Dubais most exclusive hotel accommodation from Anantaras overwater villas to Atlantiss underwater suites. Elsewhere at Skyline Defining Atlantis, there’s a world-class water park and a network of aquariums filled with 65000 inhabitants. And for a truly surreal experience, you can even walk among them. Or perhaps you prefer to fly? The latest way to get a birds eye view of this manmade megastructure in a gyrocopter. Similar to helicopters, two-seat aircraft reach heights of fifteen hundred feet. Another way to explore Palm Jumeirah is by sea, and the 78-kilometer shoreline is dotted with idyllic seaside destinations. "Club Vista Mare is tucked away on the eastern trunk, very popular destination for breakfast, lunch, and dinner, and one ‘star’ attraction of Vista Mare is its pool in the sea," says Rebecca Rees. And the new Palm Tower will showcase a wraparound infinity pool on the 50th floor, providing unparalleled views of this iconic island.

programme.title: Off the beaten track, Orlando
programme.desc: Out of the many adventures one can have in Orlando, I choose the off the beaten path things to do. My journey begins at the Orlando World Center Marriott, home to the biggest most amazing pool I’ve ever seen. What makes it even more amazing is the fact that mermaid classes are offered through the Mermaid Academy, poolside. The real adventure begins at the Paddling Center at Shingle Creek, which is a quick drive from the hotel. Lined with Cypress trees and the beautiful sounds of nature, it was the perfect setting for a relaxing kayak experience. I end my time in Orlando shopping at Artegon Marketplace. This is mall filled with local artisans who are passionate about their work and products. My highlight was being able to ride on a cute stuffed mechanical animal as I peruse the shops.

programme.title: Springtime Skiing & Surfing in California
programme.desc: California has great surfing & skiing from the Sierra Mountains to the Ventura County Coast. Check out the best spots in this edition of We Hear!

programme.title: St. Croix Part I - Beach & Shopping
programme.desc: Teri and Andrea journey to St. Croix to explore Turtle Beach on Buck Island, then taste local cuisine at LaReines Chicken Shack, then go shopping in Christansted at Shays Boutique and My Girlfriends Closet.

programme.title: Scopa Italian Roots
programme.desc: Scopas airplane hangar-like space in Venice is dominated by a 50-foot bar, communal high-tops, booming acoustics, and a jovial crowd at happy hour. The resulting vibe can only be described as surprisingly pleasant chaos. Bartenders are yelling out NEGRONI orders, servers are dancing around tables to drop Italian cold-cut platters, and diners are leaning in to converse over piles of handmade noodles.About those noodles: Top Chef vet Antonia Lofaso cooks upscale Italian with no fuss, like RIGATONI with vodka sauce and more modern takes like CRESTE RIGATE with morels and English peas. She smears nutty ricotta on ciabatta crostini and then leaves it rightly un-messed-with except for some quality olive oil and fresh parsley. The DEEP-FRIED FLUFFERNUTTER for dessert reminds you that life—and perhaps cardiac health—shouldnt be taken too seriously.

programme.title: Monkey Island
programme.desc: Needing a break from the bright lights of the big city? An escape to a simpler way of life is just a 90 minute trip from Bangkok to Monkey Island in Samut Songkhram province. For 700bht you can take a boat ride to meet the famous swimming monkeys and see how the local fishing community (Khlong Klone) lives. After feeding those ravenous monkeys some bananas, treat yourself to some amazing local seafood. It may be a perfect end to a low key Sunday after a night of the other kind of monkey business.

programme.title: High-Tech Amenities For Your Hotel Stay
programme.desc: Travel Savvy features cutting edge Hotel Technology & High-Tech Amenities in this We Hear video! Check out the latest updates as Hotels go High-Tech!

programme.title: Adventures – Explore, dive and discover the sealife in Dubai’s waters
programme.desc: An hour and a half away from the city of Dubai, Euronews James OHagan joined the Dubai-based centre Divers Down to complete his PADI training and have his first proper dive. Michela Colella, Operations Manager, Divers Down UAE said, "We will go to an average depth of 14 metres. We’ll look for trumpet fish, triggerfish, clownfish, pufferfish, boxfish." Even with the basic training completed, diving with an instructor helps you feel safer, develop the right habits, and take in all the best spots on the dive site. Some of the most spectacular coral and marine life are located just 5 metres from the surface. At that depth, everything is lit up beautifully and the air lasts much longer than at 10 or 15 metres. The reef has species ranging from stingrays to lobsters, jawfish, parrotfish, broomtail wrasse, and many others. For more experienced divers there are dozens of shipwrecks and artificial reefs to explore each with unique histories and coral formations. At times it feels as if you’re flying in slow motion in some sort of alien landscape. And before you know it, it’s time to come back to the real world. Euronews James OHagan exclaimed, "Oh! That was incredible! Breathtaking!

programme.title: The Ghosts of Greenland
programme.desc: In a land of stark beauty and natural extremes, a colony of Viking settlers vanished centuries ago. Follow along as our writer travels on a National Geographic ship from Iceland to Greenland and into a remote fjord — to seek the truth.

programme.title: Toh A
programme.desc: In the wave of casual fine dining sweeping Asia, Toh A offers French-Taiwanese fusion that packs a nice punch. In addition to the set menu of excellence, the next most intriguing part of the restaurant is surely its interior design. Built during the Japanese colonial period, the building is over a hundred years old and was even used as a previous dormitory for the National Taiwan University. The original wooden rooftop still remains within the walled gates that open up to modern , Asian interior design that immediately make the outside world melt away. With a rotational set menu, Toh A offers a culinary experience that presents traditional Taiwanese cuisine with a modern French twist unlike any other establishment in Taipei today.

programme.title: The Other Park City

programme.title: A quintessential quarantine dish
programme.desc: With the world still in lockdown to combat the coronavirus, delicious food is a topic everyone can rally around. Euronews met up with Chef Othman Reif at his Japanese restaurant in Dubai, Kushiyaki, to taste one of his signature dishes. "You’re going to get a piece of Wagyu, thin cut. And we’re going to brush with a little bit of the wagyu fat. Just sear on the one side. Have a little bit of fun you know what I mean. It’s simple, easy you know, no hassle." Click on the video link above to see how its done. ​
